text: Vicente Ramón Guerrero (Spanish: [biˈsente raˈmoŋ ɡeˈreɾo]; baptized August 10, 1782 – February 14, 1831) was a Mexican soldier and statesman who become the nation's second president. He was one of the leading generals who fought against Spain during the Mexican War of Independence During his presidency, he abolished slavery in Mexico. Guerrero was deposed in a rebellion by his Vice- President Anastasio Bustamante. title: Vicente Guerrero
